data.title: Philippa Christoforou on LinkedIn: OUI have teamed up with the University of Oxford Department of Psychiatry‚Ä¶
data.meta_description: OUI have teamed up with the University of Oxford Department of Psychiatry to support Movember. Serena is one of our amazing team of runners, walkers, swimmers,‚Ä¶
data.text:
It‚Äôs day 28 and the home stretch of Movember. This year I‚Äôm behind pace of my goal, but I‚Äôm determined to push until the end of the month to make as big of an impact as I can. I campaign every year to pay honour to the memory of my stepson Gabriel. We lost Gabriel in July of 2018 as result of mental illness, addiction and suicide. Each Movember I campaign to nudge every man out there to take care of themselves. I implore all men to live by the MO5. 1. Live a lifestyle that maintains or improves health and quality of life. 2. Develop positive habits and access to support to build mental resistance. 3. Develop and maintain positive social support networks. 4. Develop greater personal awareness of health. 5. Take action to get support when something isn‚Äôt right or health is at risk. This is why I MO every year. To pay tribute to Gabriel and to reach out to all my fellow men and encourage them to take better care of one another. So please visit my campaign page and learn a little bit more about why I MO and if you‚Äôre able to, leave a donation to help the cause. #movember2023 #mensmentalhealthawareness #prostatecancerawareness #testicularcancerawareness #menshealthawareness #suicidepreventionawareness https://lnkd.in/extB9iB

**Unveiling the Silent Struggle: A Movember Call to Action** Every 40 seconds, a life is lost to suicide. üíî **Why Movember Matters:** Beyond the mustaches, Movember is a platform to raise awareness of men‚Äôs health issues. Let's not only raise funds for prostate cancer but also break the silence surrounding mental health struggles, including the heartbreaking reality of suicide. ü§ù **Your Impact:** Every donation fuels not only cancer research but also mental health initiatives. By supporting Movember, you're contributing to a world where conversations about mental well-being are as common as growing a 'stache in November. https://lnkd.in/grqnWYf #MovemberCares #SilentStruggle #MentalHealthMatters

Movember 2023 ‚Äì Change the face of men‚Äôs health Movember is back raising money and awareness about men‚Äôs health issues such as mental health, suicide, prostate cancer and testicular cancer. Growing of moustaches is encouraged. A mo is like wearing a symbol representing healthier men which can unite and start conversations that can sprout real change. Recently, women, known as the ‚Äòmo-sistas‚Äô have joined the movement. The importance of the Mo Sista: Men‚Äôs poor health may affect men physically, but it impacts everyone in their lives, women included. Women tend to be the gateway to health in a man‚Äôs life ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a sister, mother, friend or wife - and can play a key role in helping men to start those simple health conversations. Mo Sistas can sign up, commit to MOVE and fundraise. Move is Movember‚Äôs challenge to men & women alike to get active for the 30 days of the month of November. This could be cycling, swimming, yoga etc. If you love walking or running the ‚ÄúMove for mental health challenge‚Äù involves walking or running 60km in November to remember the 60 men globally who lose their life to suicide every hour. To sign up to ‚ÄúMOVE‚Äù or ‚Äúgrow a mo‚Äù or if you wish to host your own fundraising event, click the link: www.uk.movember.com Help fly the mo flag this Movember, make a difference and help men live happier lives.

üß†üåü Celebrate the Neuro Community with Us! üåüüß† Join hands with The Neurological Alliance across the UK as we celebrate the incredible individuals, charities, not-for-profit organizations, and support networks during Brain Awareness Week this week (11‚Äì17 March 2024). Why It Matters: It's a time to honor the strength, resilience, and unity within the neurological community. Together, we raise awareness, share stories, and amplify the voices of those affected by neurological conditions. Have You Received Support? Has a person or organization provided you with invaluable support to navigate your neurological condition? Share your story! Let's shine a spotlight on the individuals and groups who make a meaningful difference in our lives. How You Can Participate: Share your gratitude: Tag the person or organization and share your appreciation. Spread awareness: Use #BrainAwarenessWeek to raise awareness and support. Join the conversation: Share your experiences and connect with others in the neuro community. üåü Let's Celebrate Unity, Strength, and Support! üåü #NeuroCommunity #BrainAwarenessWeek #SupportMatters üß†üíô

In the 14 years Flatwater Foundation has operated, 8 million dollars of therapy have been provided, which amounts to over 65,000 therapy sessions! I'm reaching out to ask for your support for an amazing cause that‚Äôs close to my heart. I'm raising funds for Flatwater Foundation, a nonprofit dedicated to providing mental health therapy and support for families affected by cancer. Their work is crucial; every donation can make a huge difference in someone's life. Here‚Äôs why you should consider donating: 1. Mental Health Support: Flatwater Foundation offers counseling and therapy to those in need, ensuring that no one has to face cancer alone. 2. Comprehensive Care: They provide services not just for patients but also for their families, promoting holistic healing and support. 3. Community Impact: By contributing, you are directly helping our community, making mental health care accessible to those who need it most. https://lnkd.in/gpqPqVkp

üö®Want to work with me for free? For every donor that contributes to my ATIME campaign before this coming Saturday night. I will donate 1 minute of free consulting to be raffled off to one of my donors. So far there has been 180 donors, so 3 hours of free consulting is on the line. ($1950 value) But wait, there's more: I'll also throw in access to a few AI tools and extra seat licenses I have as well as my personal prompt library. (Truly a gift that keeps on giving.) Please contribute even a small donation (site has an annoying minimum of $18 but you can call or email to contribute less.) Every comment on this post will get an additional entry and every share will get 2 additional entries. Every individual donation also gets an entry. So, if you want to help out a cause that is very meaningful to me, and perhaps win 3+ hours of free consulting, please participate. Here is the link: https://lnkd.in/gPe-TJZP

üß† Listen to three independent #mentalhealth experts sharing why #mentalhealtheducation is important for our communities. ‚öñ Jesse Mann says it's a #socialjustice issue. üöß Leah Aguirre says it's necessary to #breakstigma. üí™ Dr. Sola Togun-Butler, Ph.D., LCSW, LISW-S says it's a tool to build lasting #copingskills. üí´ Obviously, we could not agree more (and so does decades of scientific #research), and that's why we are doing the work we do. Thank you Jesse, Leah, and Dr. Sola, for sharing your thoughts with us! _______________________________________________________________________ ‚ù§Ô∏èWe are currently running a month-long #givingcampaign, to raise money towards bringing #mentalhealtheducation to #underserved communities. We are halfway towards our goal of $3,000. Here are four ways that you can help us reach our goal: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Donate üëâ https://lnkd.in/eY4ptx4n 2Ô∏è‚É£ Buy a book through one of our Affiliate links. Check out our previous posts for book recommendations and links! 3Ô∏è‚É£ Subscribe to our #youtube channel üëâ https://lnkd.in/eKYW-bDz 4Ô∏è‚É£ Like and share this post with your network! Each and all of these 4 actions helps us in this Giving Campaign. We are so grateful for your support. #underresourced #communitysupport #neuroscience #psychology #nonprofit #fundraising #togetherwearestronger #makingadifference #equaljustice #mentalhealthliteracy #psychoeducation #bodyhealth #mentalhealth #mentalhealthawareness #mentalillness #recoveryispossible #youarenotalone

Celebrating Founders Month: Seven Years of Impact at the Brain Center of Green Bay! Why Your Support Matters Your generous contributions help fund vital programs and initiatives that support brain health across all ages. Here are a few ways your donations make an impact: 1. Youth Brain Health Education Program: Providing educational materials and resources to young people, promoting brain health awareness from an early age. 2. Community Outreach and Education: Offering workshops, seminars, and resources to educate the public about brain health and prevention strategies. 3. Coaching Services: Providing essential support and resources to individuals and families affected by brain health issues, helping them navigate challenges and improve their quality of life. 4. Research and Innovation: Supporting cutting-edge research initiatives to advance our understanding of brain health and develop new interventions. How to Participate Participating in our Founders Month text-to-give campaign is easy and convenient. Here‚Äôs how you can join in: 1. Text 53-555: Simply text FOUNDERSMONTH 53-555 from your mobile phone. 2. Access the Campaign Page: Follow the link provided in the response to access our dedicated campaign page. 3. Donate $7:** Make a donation of $7 to commemorate our seven years of service. #braincentergb #texttogive #brainhealthmatters #committedtomakingbrainsbetter

Whether it's mental health, suicide awareness, testicular cancer or prostate cancer, many of us unite during 'Movember' to raise awareness for better men's health. So whether you‚Äôre raising money for charity by committing to a run or a walk, growing a 'mo' or simply 'mo-ing' your own way this November, we want to encourage everyone to talk more openly about the importance of men's physical and mental health. We can‚Äôt ignore the fact that men tend to be more reluctant to seek help or treatment for their health struggles and studies have highlighted that a lot of men today feel that there is a huge conflict between masculinity and seeking treatment for their mental wellbeing. In light of this, we feel it's more important than ever to raise awareness for men‚Äôs health - especially being a part of the construction industry - which is mainly male-dominated and well know for it's high stress environment! So if you‚Äôre struggling or know someone who is and want to help take a look at https://uk.movember.com for more info. #Movember #MentalHealth #MentalHealthAwareness #MensMentalHealth #Construction #Flooring #TeamBlade

Last years tash generated a lot of discussion, mainly laughing at the state of it. So of course I am doing it again this year! However, I am glad to say, there is a Reconomy Group team partaking! üéâ If you can donate, that's great. If it makes you have a conversation about your mental health or taboo subjects about changes in your body, even better. #movember #mentalhealthmatters #cancerawareness https://lnkd.in/eZfhmjhU
